justification: It misreads Team A’s injury-averse, floor-seeking profile by asking them to take a Doubtful TE and a high-variance QB while giving up their safer, ascending QB. For Team B, it acknowledges QB stability and SoS but ignores B’s strict injury avoidance by sending them a Questionable TE and overlooks their existing QB stability (Austin Reed). The rationale is brief and generic; “A upgrades TE floor” is inaccurate given Anderson’s injury. Overall fit and value logic are shaky.
